title: Electrode to replace to increase E

content.question:
Half-Reaction 
Standard Reduction Potential, <math alttext="E naught in volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>(V)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="A g with positive one charge aqueous plus one electron produce A g solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Ag(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="positive 0.80" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.80</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="C u with positive two charge aqueous plus 2 electrons produce C u solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Cu(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="positive 0.34" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.34</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="P b with positive 2 charge aqueous plus 2 electrons produce P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Pb(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="negative 0.13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.13</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="A l with positive three charge aqueous plus 3 electrons produce A l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>(</mtext><mi>a</mi><mi>q</mi><mtext>)</mtext><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext>Al(</mtext><mi>s</mi><mtext>)</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> 

<math alttext="negative 1.66" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1.66</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 

A standard galvanic cell is made using <math alttext="P b, P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Pb-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> and <math alttext="C u, C u, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cells. Which of the following modifications to the cell will cause the greatest increase in <math alttext="E naught sub cell" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and why? Assume all solutions are <math alttext="1 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

choices.label: Replacing the <math alttext="C u, Cu, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell with a <math alttext="A g, A g N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Ag-</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell, because the reduction of <math alttext="1 mole" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>1 mol</mtext></mrow></math> of <math alttext="A g with a positive one charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>Ag</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> requires only <math alttext="1 mole" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>1 mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="electrons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 0.67 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>0.67</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Replacing the <math alttext="C u, C u, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Cu-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Cu</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell with a <math alttext="A g, A g N O 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Ag-</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>AgNO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell, because less current flows through the cell, resulting in <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 0.93 volt" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>0.93</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Replacing the <math alttext="P b, P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Pb-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell with an <math alttext="A l, A l, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Al-</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell, because the oxidation of <math alttext="A l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is more thermodynamically favorable than the oxidation of <math alttext="P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 2.00 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Replacing the <math alttext="P b, P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Pb-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell with an <math alttext="A l, A l, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Al-</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell, because <math alttext="6 moles" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>6 mol</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="electrons" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> flow through the cell, resulting in <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 5.66 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>5.66</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Replacing the <math alttext="P b, P b, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Pb-</mtext><msub><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mtext>(</mtext><mtext>NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell with an <math alttext="A l, A l, open parenthesis, N O 3, close parenthesis, 3" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>Al-</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>Al(NO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>)</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> half-cell, because the oxidation of <math alttext="A l solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Al</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> is more thermodynamically favorable than the oxidation of <math alttext="P b solid" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>Pb</mtext><mo>(</mo><mi>s</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, resulting in <math alttext="E naught sub cell equals positive 2.00 volts" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>E</mi><mi>°</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>c</mi><mi>e</mi><mi>l</mi><mi>l</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>2.00</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>V</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 2.F: Explain how modifications to an experimental procedure will alter results.
